Not many people care about this, but this is the most fun game to do 100% all achievements. The achievement hunt of Cuphead is very challenging but they do not ask you to do something you wouldn't want to, it just asks you to master the core of the game and get good. Very fun, mature game design decisions.

Was meant to write a review for Cuphead after beating the game and deciding whether or not to grab The Delicious Last Course. But itâ€™ll probably take quite a while before I reach that point and you know what, thatâ€™s totally fine. It took me eight years just to finally start playing it. Plus, Iâ€™m not exactly in a situation right now where I can just summon the motivation to finish it no matter what, especially with plenty of other games catching my attention. Still, hope to finish it someday.

The difference between many masocore, soulslike or just games with a high difficulty and frustration level and Cuphead, is that this one really really grabs me, visually and musically. 
The whole look and sound hits something deep in me, and even though Iâ€™ve honestly thought about just watching a playthrough, I actually want to experience it myself. That old-school Betty Boop/Fleischer style just has something special, the way arms and legs move like rubber hoses, objects come to life, and everything feels a bit surreal. Of course, nostalgia also plays a big part.
Maybe Iâ€™m not telling anyone anything new here, but I was blown away when the soundtrack hit number one on the US Billboard Jazz Charts and even made it into the Guinness Book of World Records. Back then just like now, I really wanted that soundtrack on vinyl. But just like with games, thereâ€™s so much other great music out there. Still, I really hope that one day the OST will find its way onto my record shelf.

Cuphead is one of the most successful indie games of all time, with around six million copies sold. So yeah a lot of people bought it, played it and failed miserably. Well, not everyone, a few actually pushed through and someone out there has probably even mastered it. With Cuphead itâ€™s not really you playing the game, itâ€™s the game playing with you. Itâ€™s pretty fair for the most part, but it still wants to crush you. Iâ€™d love to be part of the nine percent who make it all the way to the end, and when I finally do, Iâ€™ll reward myself by watching a ton of reaction and fail videos. 
Then again, maybe Iâ€™ll fail spectacularly, throw my controller at the main monitor, bite off the corners of my Editors Keys - Designed for Ableton Live or just jump out the window. 
Still, letâ€™s hope it doesnâ€™t come to that.

If you want to see how Iâ€™m doing, you can check out this video, though itâ€™s a little compilation that also includes three other games: Best Month Ever, Look Mum No Computer and Road 96. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=irVd26mjWlo&t=2421s
Amazing game that mainly revolves around fighting bosses. Art style and music are great and feel unlike any other game out there. It is a difficult game but patience pays off so keep trying.

This game is so horrifically hard, it's practically ragebait at times
Good ragebait
They the game only cost 20 euros but its wrong it costed me a new keyboard, a new controller AND a new monitor

A true masterpiece! Creative boss battles that can be challenging but rewarding, a gorgeous hand-drawn 1930s art style (it really seems like you are playing an animation), and an amazing jazzy soundtrack. It's a real pleasure to replay the game and see how much you've improved, earning S-ranks after not that much effort.
Would easily recommend this game for the artstyle alone. The amount of work that went into crafting the game shows.

Cuphead is one of my favorite video games of all time. 
It's got such a good artstyle, rythm, boss design and characters.
The DLC is also top-notch, even better than the last game!
The new bosses are fun and exciting but at the same time fair and balanced. 
Aside from some hickups along the way, like Rumor Honeybottom or the Dragon, I think the game is really good and I absolutely would recommend you play this!

Cuphead defines a genre, it is incredibly beautiful and just as challenging. I have completed many games, but few have felt as entertaining as Cuphead: in most games, overcoming an obstacle is often a mere relief, but this game makes you feel like a champion.
Every section of this game is unforgettable. The gameplay is very fast-paced and dynamic, the arsenal is wide and the player is encouraged to come up with different builds.
The music perfectly accompanies the player throughout the various sections of the game almost in a cinematic way, the fights being presented like episodes of old cartoons. The animation is just as impressive and it truly feels timeless, the drawings are so beautiful and stunningly hand drawn.
Overall, this game is a pleasure for all the senses and, when I play it, I often admire it in astonishment and feel nostalgic for a distant but incredibly familiar time.
If you have patience and perseverance, do yourself a favour and play this work of art: you will not regret it.

One of the best "run and gun" games ever! Has some of the most beautiful, awe-inspiring, hand drawn art i've ver seen! Definitely worth playing! 

The game is also a 10/10 for the gameplay and has an incredible OST!

Definitely purchase the DLC also for this game! Well worth the price!

It's also a good challenge for anyone who loves Run and Gun levels and great boss challenges!
great game with chanenging but rewarding boss fights.makes you play with different play styles and all of them are fun
i love this art style, the game play everything is amazing 10/10 recommend
Amazing game! The graphics are awesome, and it has almost infinite replayability!! One of my favorite games right now!

Cuphead is an incredibly fun and challenging but fair game. It has a fantastic art style, tons of cool and fun to fight bosses, enjoyable gameplay, and is satisfying to master. I cannot recommend this game enough for anyone who likes boss fight focused games. The DLC, "The Delicious Last Course" is absolutely worth it too.

I appreciate the effort, I really do. The animation is gorgeous, the soundtrack is snazzy and jazzy, the storyline and the characters are fun, and I bet the game is offering an expert challenge for the veterans of the platforming genre. 

Here's the catch, it's the Dark Souls of platformers. 

If someone would finish this game 100%, they'd be qualified to do the speedruns of it. But maybe it's your thing. If you want a tough-as-nails challenge, this is your game. Me? I'll continue to enjoy the soundtrack, and watch the Let's Play videos of the game whenever I want to reminisce it.

I love Cuphead. I have it on my switch lite, and I have it completed on every account, all 3 save files. Including Steam and export mode on only 1 or 2 of the saves, I have beaten Cuphead around 28 times. The art is amazing, the music is amazing, everything about it is amazing. This is my favorite game, thank you to everyone who has worked on it.

This game will make you feel pain like you've never felt. Like worse than Naruto Pain

We start off with what looks like an 80s style cartoon show. The plot is written and now your soul is suddenly owned by the devil himself. And of course the only way to clear the debt is to play the game and win it. Sounds easy right?

Wrong. Playing this game with another person will drive you both mad. It's not enough to play perfectly but you both have to play perfectly. Due to the share screen nature both players have to stay in sync or risk slipping or stalling the screen from progressing whiles enemies and projectiles continue their trajectory towards your little bodies with big cup heads as easy targets.

Pain aside, this game is genuinely fun when you can finally clear a stage. It takes hours and hours, sometimes days to finally reach the next level. But when you do that feeling is unforgetable. Its the kind of game that exemplifies the value of perseverance. For young kids this game can potentially be a good teacher in that aspect.

I still have only cleared like 5 levels so far at the time of this writing so theres very much left to play. Replay value is great. Enemy variety and boss fights are top notch. This is a game you can play forever and keep coming back to

Don't let the friendly, retro cartoon look fool youâ€”this game is not friendly. It is a brutal, unforgiving challenge disguised as a 1930s cartoon. I strongly salute the artistic dedication here; the fact that everything is hand-drawn gives it a unique style that is stunning to look at, even when you are dying for the fiftieth time.

I played this entirely solo, and while the boss fights are incredibly well-designed with mechanics you have to learn and master, it was easily one of the most frustrating games to 100% complete. It demands perfection and patience. If you are looking for a casual platformer, look elsewhere. But if you enjoy a tough challenge and appreciate top-tier art direction, this is for you.

Cuphead is one of the greatest indie games of all time IMO. The boss fights are challenging but still quite fun (some can be a pain to S rank though), the art style and animations are both top notch, the soundtrack is amazing - go play it.
fun game it has a beautifle art style and great chalenging gameplay
Such a fun game, Old time feel and you can still go back and play more. I love the little secrets and details, this is my new favorite game

Engraved in the 1930s with its rubberhose animation and dazzling jazz music, Cuphead is not only a beautiful and brutal run and gun game, but also a testament to how a burning passion and uncompromising vision can lead to one of the best indie games of all time.
Simply put, this game will make you suffer, and celebrate every single win. It's also, in my opinion, the single most beautiful game in terms of the animation style, that I have ever played.

This game is a very fun, cartoony style 2d platformer full of challenges and difficult fights. Keeps me hooked every inch of the way. The only thing i would change if i could is to add one more isle   with a few more bosses and challenges.
10/10

This is truly one of the best games I've ever played. It's so charming in its whole concept, and its art-style is just *chef's kiss*.

If you, like me, imagined what it would be like to enter the world of your favourite cartoons as a kid - this is that experience. I never thought it would be possible. The hand-drawn art and animation just makes it one of the most special games of all time.

This is what happens when a developer dares to dream. And it's executed perfectly.

I can't wait to connect up a couple of controllers and play with friends!

Cuphead is without a doubt the best looking 2D game ever made, unfortunately it is not made for people who easily give up. After S-Ranking every boss and getting every achievement I can confidently say that beating the game normally is not only not that bad but is actually pretty easy as long as you deduce where the projectiles are coming from and use every resource in your tool kit to come up with a strategy. The DLC is great as well however I do think they toned up the difficulty by a giant margin considering the amount of stuff you have to deal with on the screen at any given time is like 3 times as much as the main game, however it is still great fun and the cow boss is my favorite boss in all of cuphead. You should definitely not try to s-rank every boss however considering it does not give you a reward or even an achievement for doing all of them, however I do think if you love the game then getting all the achievements is pretty simple. Cuphead is an outstanding game that is visually gorgeous and provides a challenge that I feel anyone can enjoy, really hoping for a sequel even though it will probably take like 20 years.
this game is full of action and retro-futurisitic, rlly fun if ur bored.

It's maybe the most successful indie title ever for a simple reason - it's basically perfect. A boss battle rush that feels challenging but never unfair and becomes increasingly addictive for just "one more try". I feel like there's little more to say that would convince those who haven't bought this game to play it. Each boss is just crafted with so much love and the art style is just chef's kiss all the way through. Nothing to complain about!
Tough as nails but so rewarding. The art style, music, and gameplay all come together perfectly.

Cuphead is one of the most unique and unforgettable games I've played. The game stands out through its 1930s cartoon art style, hand-drawn animations, jazz soundtrack, and pure personality packaged into each boss fight. It does not just look good; it truly feels like you're playing inside an old-school cartoon brought to life.

The gameplay's tough, but in a great way: Every boss tests your reactions, your timing, your ability to adapt. When you lose, it never feels unfair â€” you always know exactly what you did wrong and beating a boss feels insanely satisfying. That â€œone more tryâ€ feeling hits hard.

The creativity in this game is crazy. Literally, every fight is a new theme, new mechanics, new animations; nothing ever feels reused. It's one of those games where you can't predict what's coming next, and that keeps it exciting the whole way through.

Cuphead sticks with you. The art, the challenge, the music â€” it all melds into something that doesnâ€™t feel like any other game. Itâ€™s easily one of the best and most stylish games Iâ€™ve ever played, and beating it feels like an accomplishment youâ€™re genuinely proud of.

If you are looking for difficulty, this is definitely your game. The challenge is fantastic, and the replayability is great because the game lets you set your own limits on how hard you want to push your skills.

Cuphead really captures that 1900's cartoon vibe that the creators went for! It's gameplay is really interactive and the show is great! NEED more games like this! The DLC is also a pretty good game! The storyline is unique and captivating, and overall really creative! 5 stars for sure!
This game has one of the best soundtracks I've ever heard in a video game. The animation is incredible. Tough as nails yet still fair.

Cuphead is great. ESPECIALLY with the DLC. It's really fun, and you can replay it a lot without it getting old. The game is simple, but requires skill, and each boss has their own attacks and quirks. Cuphead and Mugman are great, but Chalice is better for most of the ground bosses.Anyway, PLAY CUPHEAD! GET DLC!

TL;DR 7/10, passable Gunstar Heroes clone but it's dragged down by poor design.

It's okay for what it is. It looks, runs, and plays well, but there's way too much RNG in the design since you have the boss patterns, but then you have the stage hazards on top of that, which often force you into unavoidable damage unless you're using the dash with i-frames. The first-time player traps are utterly copious, and the game's idea of "difficulty" is often-times just not letting you see. With the exception of one (Dr. Kahl's if I'm being generous, but his phase 2 is embarrassingly bad), all the shmup levels are a snorefest. Default control scheme is also terrible. The weapon balance is off. The tracer is way too strong. Charge-up laser is too weak. There's a pretty blatant exploit on the Phantom Express boss that should've been ironed out (second phase lasers can't hit you on their own side if you hug the edge of the screen). A lot of enemies have iffy hitboxes that makes shooting them obnoxious. King Dice's cards don't run fast enough, making you run into his hand unavoidably depending on the pattern. When Sally Stageplay transitions from the 3rd to 4th phase you'll often get hit unavoidably by a wave dude that still comes at you.  Great design, guys. Phase 3 Cala Maria, like, WTF is wrong with you, devs? Truly taking RNG trash to a whole different level. Carnation can also force you into unavoidable hits with his vines depending on the pattern. Phase 3 Grim Matchstick also just felt, weird? I don't know how else to put it. It seemed like the fireballs would just spawn out of thin air sometimes, and if you don't get above the flamethrower you're screwed, but then if you don't have beans or tracer then you're just sitting there doing nothing. Essentially there's almost no good damage opportunities aside from very specific setups. Some bosses are also just egregiously crappy like Mangosteen, Mr. Wheezy, Mr. Chimes, Pip and Dot, and Phear Lap. Just because you want to rip off Gunstar Heroes's board game doesn't give you carte blanche to put all of your garbage rejected bosses back into the game. I could go on for a while. Almost every boss has issues in their design. Best bosses were probably the Devil, Werner Werman, and Brineybeard. The game also sorely needs a colorblind assist. For someone like me that can't tell pink from red and blue it made it near impossible to parry. You don't even need a colorblind mode though, just having better visual design would've done it, because I think even normal-sighted people would still have trouble knowing what's parryable or not. I'd say this game is good enough, but could use a LOT of improvement. Levels either oscillate between very boring or very difficult, with little in-between and certainly no curve to it. That said, most of the difficulty comes from bad design or cheap tricks, without a lot of substantive challenge or fun to be found. Clearly inspiration was taken from Gunstar Heroes (if not for the parry mechanic you could almost call it a bad rip-off) but, I think the devs should go back, play that game again, and remember why it was, you know, good. Also maybe hire someone with actual game design chops. Then they can make a much better follow-up. Played on regular, total playtime was 6 1/2 hours (I had an hour already from a few years ago when I was unsuccessfully trying to get the game to work on Parsec. It should work fine now, Parsec has improved significantly). That reminds me though, no online play is a huge negative. 7/10 Haven't played the DLC yet, hopefully that's better.

Itâ€™s not a game; itâ€™s a beautifully animated apology from your controller for existing.

A real gem. The art direction is superb. The game design is sublime. Iâ€™ve only got a few hours into it and I know itâ€™ll be a GOAT for me. 

It is really a nostalgic experience for anyone growing up in the 90s. Boss fight after boss fight is super frustrating, but when you finally nail whole stage and beat the baddie itâ€™s a great feeling. 

Donâ€™t think and just buy it already.

300% beat the game on console and pc now one of my favorite games 10/10

also dont play on higher than 60fps or the enemies projectiles will be to fast to dodge
i love this game so much that i also have it on the switch and on the switch i 300% it i put my hart and soul into getting every achievement and i'm willing to do it again

So while yes, it's true, Cuphead is what I would call the certified definition of infuriating, it's also freakishly fun. The game play works incredibly, the music and style is extremely fun and the character designs are immaculate. But yeah, you might need to buy a couple extra controllers so you can throw one or two at your monitor/tv to let some aggression out

forgot to write a review on this game. anyways, here's my thoughts:

It's a fun game when you know the mechanics and stuff, though sometimes it can be horrifyingly difficult that i almost killed myslef

Ignore the fact i have only 3 hours on the game.

negative.review: What a beautiful game. Any gamer should experience and see Cuphead at least once. As many know its creation was an audacious undertaking by a profoundly dedicated and hardworking team, and I respect the heck out of it as one the significant games of my lifetime playing games. Downsides are the many glitches, bugs, fmystery hitboxes, parries that damage you but give you a card anyway...playing it past regular is a very unenjoyable grind. On the whole, the game has probably given me more grief than joy. But judging off of the games it is modeled after, I think that's sort of the point. Cuphead is clearly built for the challenge- which means, it is not designed to be beat- which would be tolerable, but the game is not designed correctly at many moments. Had I known that going in, I probably wouldn't have tried it. For its many faults I give MDHR my endless respect.

This game is undoubtedly visually stunning, and I have nothing but respect for the amount of effort that went into creating all of the artwork in this game. I wish I had the same amount of praise for the actual video game itself. For a game that prides itself on it's artwork, it seems obsessed with hiding the character off-screen as much as possible, making simple jumps into leaps of faith. The game also seems to want to be as  Ì¶dÌ¶iÌ¶fÌ¶fÌ¶iÌ¶cÌ¶uÌ¶lÌ¶tÌ¶  annoying as possible: the platforming is unnecessarily pixel perfect in some places, some fights are full of RNG, the two gun options at the start of the game are the only useful ones, the super moves are only useful during the flying sections, just to name a few.

Yes, the design and animations are wonderful.
Yes, the musics are incredible.
But it's INSANELY HARD! Even in easy mode (and this mode doesn't permit to access the fourth part of the game).
So, I stopped in the second part of the game, I won't be able to spend the rest of the game. Really too bad.
But yes, the game is beautiful.

Edit: Ok, the game is so much easier with the Chaser Weapon (you don't need to aim anymore).

I'm a sucker for challenging games which is why I bought this, it does have overwhelmingly positive reviews after all, accompanied with great art style, love it! Only to realize that the game has pretty much no exploration, and is just a boss rush which is usually fine and I actually had fun playing the first few bosses, but the combat is just not my style, hard to control too.

film grain effects hurts my eyes and there is no option for disabling this effect 

dont get me wrong im not proggressive sjw, its just my eye condition doesnt let me enjoy this game

Its trash if you want to play with no xbox or playstation controller, but the game is actually good, but i dont have a controller

its pretty good but my god is it just SO HARD! i havent even passed the first world, and i think chasing that boss youve been working towards beating just isnt for me. i get wayyyy to angry with the trial and error (which is more to do with me then the game tbf) so ive only been playing this game on and off for the time ive owned it, ive been stuck on the same boss and same basic level for probable close to two years-ish consecutively. 

its an amazing game, but i just cant recommend it as i think its way to hard to enjoy. if youre the type who loves a good challenge and have the determination to keep trying no matter what this is the game for you. i know probably a lot of my issues come from a lack of skill, but even when i believe im doing really well i still end up dead and starting again. 

its artstyle is fantastic, the music is phonominal, the story is just great. but i cant beat this thing no matter how long i try.

Yes, the design and animations are wonderful.
Yes, the musics are incredible.
But it's INSANELY HARD! Even in easy mode (and this mode doesn't permit to access the fourth part of the game).
So, I stopped in the second part of the game, I won't be able to spend the rest of the game. Really too bad.
But yes, the game is beautiful.

Edit: Ok, the game is so much easier with the Chaser Weapon (you don't need to aim anymore).

This game is undoubtedly visually stunning, and I have nothing but respect for the amount of effort that went into creating all of the artwork in this game. I wish I had the same amount of praise for the actual video game itself. For a game that prides itself on it's artwork, it seems obsessed with hiding the character off-screen as much as possible, making simple jumps into leaps of faith. The game also seems to want to be as  Ì¶dÌ¶iÌ¶fÌ¶fÌ¶iÌ¶cÌ¶uÌ¶lÌ¶tÌ¶  annoying as possible: the platforming is unnecessarily pixel perfect in some places, some fights are full of RNG, the two gun options at the start of the game are the only useful ones, the super moves are only useful during the flying sections, just to name a few.

Just play https://store.steampowered.com/app/524220/NieRAutomata/
All the issues you are having with this game are fixed there.


[b]TOO MUCH FU**ING STUFF HAPPENING AT THE SAME FU**ING TIME.[/b]
I don't mind impossible bosses but in the first world, the flower and the flying boss just showed how terrible this game can get with so much stuff happening on the screen at the same time that it becomes impossible to keep track of.
Yes, I did beat them but the experience was terrible and even when I did beat it, it was mainly chance that something happened at the correct time.

I thought I am playing something like Hollow Knight but this game is more like Geometry Dash and I fucking hate Geometry Dash where you don't win because of your skill but because you have remembred what exactly to do.

Compare this to Sekiro where you can beat a completely new boss but you still know what skill will work and what will not work and can make a good guess so that makes it fun. FUCK SEKIRO, that game was so good it has ruined every other game for me.

I like difficult games that involve skill.
With this I am just frustrated because all my deaths are not based on my skill but on random events and terrible hit-boxes or just playing the same level over and over again until you learn what to press at every time.

[hr][/hr]

[h1]Playing on Android[/h1]
Playing the [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iD9PFVhLLok]Steam Version of this game on Android via GameHub[/url] at a locked 60fps with a [url=https://ni6hant.com/accessories/controllers/phone-gamepads/ant-esports-combatant-2/]phone gamepad[/url] on which I bound one button on the back to fire and didn't have to worry about firing throughout.
Note: The unofficial android port by SpanishFreddy plays beautifully but had a few minor bugs which might be okay if you can't run the Steam version of the game on your phone but I stick to the steam version for the achievements.
In principle it's a fantastic concept with beautiful animation, which is why I bought the game in the first place, but it is much, much too hard for a casual gamer!

What a beautiful game. Any gamer should experience and see Cuphead at least once. As many know its creation was an audacious undertaking by a profoundly dedicated and hardworking team, and I respect the heck out of it as one the significant games of my lifetime playing games. Downsides are the many glitches, bugs, fmystery hitboxes, parries that damage you but give you a card anyway...playing it past regular is a very unenjoyable grind. On the whole, the game has probably given me more grief than joy. But judging off of the games it is modeled after, I think that's sort of the point. Cuphead is clearly built for the challenge- which means, it is not designed to be beat- which would be tolerable, but the game is not designed correctly at many moments. Had I known that going in, I probably wouldn't have tried it. For its many faults I give MDHR my endless respect.

This game is undoubtedly visually stunning, and I have nothing but respect for the amount of effort that went into creating all of the artwork in this game. I wish I had the same amount of praise for the actual video game itself. For a game that prides itself on it's artwork, it seems obsessed with hiding the character off-screen as much as possible, making simple jumps into leaps of faith. The game also seems to want to be as  Ì¶dÌ¶iÌ¶fÌ¶fÌ¶iÌ¶cÌ¶uÌ¶lÌ¶tÌ¶  annoying as possible: the platforming is unnecessarily pixel perfect in some places, some fights are full of RNG, the two gun options at the start of the game are the only useful ones, the super moves are only useful during the flying sections, just to name a few.

Yes, the design and animations are wonderful.
Yes, the musics are incredible.
But it's INSANELY HARD! Even in easy mode (and this mode doesn't permit to access the fourth part of the game).
So, I stopped in the second part of the game, I won't be able to spend the rest of the game. Really too bad.
But yes, the game is beautiful.

Edit: Ok, the game is so much easier with the Chaser Weapon (you don't need to aim anymore).

I'm a sucker for challenging games which is why I bought this, it does have overwhelmingly positive reviews after all, accompanied with great art style, love it! Only to realize that the game has pretty much no exploration, and is just a boss rush which is usually fine and I actually had fun playing the first few bosses, but the combat is just not my style, hard to control too.

What a beautiful game. Any gamer should experience and see Cuphead at least once. As many know its creation was an audacious undertaking by a profoundly dedicated and hardworking team, and I respect the heck out of it as one the significant games of my lifetime playing games. Downsides are the many glitches, bugs, fmystery hitboxes, parries that damage you but give you a card anyway...playing it past regular is a very unenjoyable grind. On the whole, the game has probably given me more grief than joy. But judging off of the games it is modeled after, I think that's sort of the point. Cuphead is clearly built for the challenge- which means, it is not designed to be beat- which would be tolerable, but the game is not designed correctly at many moments. Had I known that going in, I probably wouldn't have tried it. For its many faults I give MDHR my endless respect.

This game is undoubtedly visually stunning, and I have nothing but respect for the amount of effort that went into creating all of the artwork in this game. I wish I had the same amount of praise for the actual video game itself. For a game that prides itself on it's artwork, it seems obsessed with hiding the character off-screen as much as possible, making simple jumps into leaps of faith. The game also seems to want to be as  Ì¶dÌ¶iÌ¶fÌ¶fÌ¶iÌ¶cÌ¶uÌ¶lÌ¶tÌ¶  annoying as possible: the platforming is unnecessarily pixel perfect in some places, some fights are full of RNG, the two gun options at the start of the game are the only useful ones, the super moves are only useful during the flying sections, just to name a few.

Yes, the design and animations are wonderful.
Yes, the musics are incredible.
But it's INSANELY HARD! Even in easy mode (and this mode doesn't permit to access the fourth part of the game).
So, I stopped in the second part of the game, I won't be able to spend the rest of the game. Really too bad.
But yes, the game is beautiful.

Edit: Ok, the game is so much easier with the Chaser Weapon (you don't need to aim anymore).

I'm a sucker for challenging games which is why I bought this, it does have overwhelmingly positive reviews after all, accompanied with great art style, love it! Only to realize that the game has pretty much no exploration, and is just a boss rush which is usually fine and I actually had fun playing the first few bosses, but the combat is just not my style, hard to control too.

dont get me wrong im not proggressive sjw, its just my eye condition doesnt let me enjoy this game

terrible game its very hard and the 2nd island is really bad they give you the hardest bosses in that area first and will make little kids cry
Its trash if you want to play with no xbox or playstation controller, but the game is actually good, but i dont have a controller
